page.title: 04LOWESWATER PARK WARDEN
page.content: The Lake District National Park covers 880 square miles and is divided into 4 areas. Holme Wood is in the North West area of the Lake District National Park, which extends from Threlkeld to Helvellyn and west to the coast. Voluntary Park Wardens are trained in map reading, First Aid, N.P. Organisation law concerning Voluntary Wardens, mountain and water rescue and compass work. They undertake a minimum of 12 duties annually, assist with work parties, take guided walks and collect litter. Reports are submitted after patrols on damage to walls, fences and bridges, blocked streams and culverts, and erosion of footpaths. A Warden may be asked to help repair any of these as a duty. This can involve carrying heavy material up a fell!
